wikipedia.title: Rhydderch ap Dyfnwal
wikipedia.summary: Rhydderch ap Dyfnwal (fl. 971) was an eminent tenth-century Cumbrian, and possibly a son of Dyfnwal ab Owain, King of Strathclyde.

wikipedia.title: Owain Foel
wikipedia.summary: Owain Foel (fl. 1018), also known as Owen the Bald, and Eugenius Calvus, was an eleventh-century King of Strathclyde.

wikipedia.title: Owain ap Dyfnwal (died 1015)
wikipedia.summary: Owain ap Dyfnwal (died 1015) may have been an eleventh-century ruler of the Kingdom of the Cumbrians.

wikipedia.title: Ragnall mac Gofraid
wikipedia.summary: Ragnall mac Gofraid (died 1004/1005) was King of the Isles and likely a member of the Uí Ímair kindred.group=note He was a son of Gofraid mac Arailt, King of the Isles.

wikipedia.title: Suibne mac Cináeda
wikipedia.summary: Suibne mac Cináeda (died 1034) was an eleventh-century ruler of the Gall Gaidheil, a population of mixed Scandinavian and Gaelic ethnicity.group=note There is little known of Suibne as he is only attested in three sources that record the year of his death.

wikipedia.title: Arthgal ap Dyfnwal
wikipedia.summary: Arthgal ap Dyfnwal (died 872) was a tenth-century King of Alt Clut.group=note He descended from a long line of rulers of the British Kingdom of Alt Clut.

wikipedia.title: Dyfnwal ab Owain
wikipedia.summary: Dyfnwal ab Owain (died 975) was a tenth-century King of Strathclyde.group=note He was a son of Owain ap Dyfnwal, King of Strathclyde, and seems to have been a member of the royal dynasty of Strathclyde.

wikipedia.title: Cuilén
wikipedia.summary: Cuilén mac Illuilb (died 971) was an early mediaeval King of Alba.group=note He was a son of Illulb mac Custantín, King of Alba, and member of Clann Áeda meic Cináeda, a branch of the Alpínid dynasty.

wikipedia.title: Echmarcach mac Ragnaill
wikipedia.summary: Echmarcach mac Ragnaill (died 1064/1065) was a dominant figure in the eleventh-century Irish Sea region.group=note At his height, he reigned as king over Dublin, the Isles, and perhaps the Rhinns of Galloway.

wikipedia.title: Godred Crovan
wikipedia.summary: Godred Crovan (died 1095), known in Gaelic as Gofraid Crobán, Gofraid Meránach, and Gofraid Méránach,group=note was a Norse-Gaelic ruler of the kingdoms of Dublin and the Isles.

wikipedia.title: Eochaid, son of Rhun
wikipedia.summary: Eochaid (fl. 878–889) was a ninth-century Briton who may have ruled as King of Strathclyde and/or King of the Picts.group=note He was a son of Rhun ab Arthgal, King of Strathclyde, and descended from a long line of British kings.
